pageContext.claim: “He [FBI Director Chris Wray] was appointed by Rod Rosenstein. … He was recommended by Chris [Christie] but he was appointed by -- he was really recommended by Rod Rosenstein and Chris said, ‘Fine, let's see what happens with him.’”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, Trump and not Rosenstein nominated Chris Wray to be the FBI director. At the time, it was widely reported that Christie -- and not Rosenstein -- was the Trump adviser pushing for Wray's appointment. Wray had been Christie's personal lawyer during the Bridgegate scandal, and Christie publicly voiced his support for the nomination. But in the intervening years, Wray has earned some criticism from Trump allies and the president and others have distanced themselves from Wray.
